department.dept_long_name: Department of Earth and Planetary Sciences

course.title: Structural Geology and Tectonics
course.meeting_text: M., W., 1–2:30, and three hours of laboratory work each week
course.description: An introduction to the deformation of Earth materials, including the processes of mountain building and plate tectonics, faulting and earthquakes, folding, and ductile deformation. Structures are examined using geologic maps, balanced cross sections, seismic reflection data, satellite imagery, microscopic analysis, analog experiments, and numerical methods. Labs emphasize the applications of structural geology in the energy and environmental industries, and for assessing earthquake hazards.
course.prerequisites: EPS 7, 8, or 21; or permission of instructor.
